thread.title: Extra! Extra! Calling all Palm Beach Post newsboys
thread.title_full: Extra! Extra! Calling all Palm Beach Post newsboys | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: palmbeachpost
title: Extra! Extra! Calling all Palm Beach Post newsboys
text:
Did you deliver The Palm Beach Post or The Palm Beach Times when you were growing up in Palm Beach County?
The Palm Beach Post is looking for former newsboys as we plan to celebrate our 100th birthday in 2016.
Jimmy Shirley Jimmy L. Shirley Jr. rode his mighty Schwinn Stingray to deliver The Palm Beach Times in Pahokee from 1965 through 1966 when he was 11 and 12.
“Back then, the Times did not publish a weekend paper, but was delivered on Saturday and Sunday as The Palm Beach Post-Times. The Saturday paper was delivered in the afternoon, as through the week, but the Sunday paper had to be delivered before sunrise, which meant for me, getting up betwixt the hours of 3 a.m. and 4 a.m. to get to where the papers were delivered for distribution. Here I was, 11 years old, getting up all by myself, riding my bicycle to my destination in the dark of early morning. Whether rain, fog, cold or hot, the paper was delivered.”
What’s your Post paperboy story? Please email us at pbfeatures@gmail.com and tell us when you were a Post paperboy, what you learned from the experience and any other fond memories.
Have you saved historic Palm Beach Post front pages or important clippings from The Post over the years? We’d love to hear from you, too. Please email us at pbfeatures@gmail.com.
</span
